sen.j: 藤原多比能（ふじわら の たびの、生没年不詳）は藤原不比等の娘で、母は県犬養三千代。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Tabino (year of birth and death unknown) was a daughter of FUJIWARA no Fuhito and her mother was Agata no INUKAI no Michiyo.
FUJIWARA no Tabino (year of birth and death unknown) was a daughter of FUJIWARA no Fuhito and her mother was Agata no INUKAI no Michiyo.
FUJIWARA no Tabino (year of birth and death unknown) was a daughter of FUJIWARA no Fuhito and her mother was Agata no INUKAI no Michiyo.

sen.j: 橘諸兄の正室、橘奈良麻呂の母。
sen.e: She was a lawful wife of TACHIBANA no Moroe and a mother of TACHIBANA no Naramaro.
She was a lawful wife of TACHIBANA no Moroe and a mother of TACHIBANA no Naramaro.
She was a lawful wife of TACHIBANA no Moroe and a mother of TACHIBANA no Naramaro.

sen.j: 聖武天皇の皇后である光明皇后は同母姉妹にあたり、夫である諸兄は異父兄妹にあたる。
sen.e: The Empress Komyo, an empress of the Emperor Shomu was her maternal half-sister and his husband, Moroe was her maternal half-brother.
The Empress Komyo, an empress of the Emperor Shomu was her maternal half-sister and her husband, Moroe was her maternal half-brother.
sen.cmt: his husband は間違いです。
sen.e: The Empress Komyo, an empress of the Emperor Shomu was her maternal half-sister and her husband, Moroe was her maternal half-brother.

sen.j: 藤原武智麻呂、藤原房前、藤原宇合、藤原麻呂、藤原宮子らの異母兄弟である。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Muchimaro, FUJIWARA no Fusasaki, FUJIWARA no Umakai, FUJIWARA no Maro and FUJIWARA no Miyako were her paternal half-sisters and half-brothers.
FUJIWARA no Muchimaro, FUJIWARA no Fusasaki, FUJIWARA no Umakai, FUJIWARA no Maro and FUJIWARA no Miyako were her paternal half-sisters and half-brothers.
FUJIWARA no Muchimaro, FUJIWARA no Fusasaki, FUJIWARA no Umakai, FUJIWARA no Maro and FUJIWARA no Miyako were her paternal half-sisters and half-brothers.

sen.j: 『続日本紀』に出てくる女官「藤原吉日」は多比能と同一人物とする説が定説となっている（角田文衛説）。
sen.e: An established theory (advocated by Bunei TSUNODA) suggests that a court lady, FUJIWARA no Yoshihi appearing in "Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicle of Japan Continued) and Tabino were the same person.
An established theory (advocated by Bunei TSUNODA) suggests that a court lady, FUJIWARA no Yoshihi appearing in "Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicle of Japan Continued) was Tabino.
sen.cmt: suggest~A and B were よりも the same person suggest~A was Bのほうが意味は同じで、プレーンでわかりやすいと思われます。
sen.e: An established theory (advocated by Bunei TSUNODA) suggests that a court lady, FUJIWARA no Yoshihi appearing in "Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicle of Japan Continued) was Tabino.

sen.j: 諸兄の母は三千代であるため、諸兄との結婚は同母兄妹の近親婚となる。
sen.e: Moroe's mother was Michoyo, so, marrying Moroe resulted in a consanguineous marriage between a maternal half-brother and a maternal half-sister.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Moroe's mother was Michyio, so, marrying Moroe resulted in a consanguineous marriage between a half-brother and a half-sister by their mother.
sen.cmt: Michoyo →Michiyomaternal half-brother and a maternal half-sister では同じ単語同士が同文のなかで繰り返しているため好ましくないと思います。
sen.e: Moroe's mother was Michyio, so, marrying Moroe resulted in a consanguineous marriage between a half-brother and a half-sister by their mother.

sen.j: そのため、三千代の子とする説は疑問が残る。
sen.e: Therefore, the question remains; was she a daughter of Michiyo?
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Therefore, it is questionable whether she was atually Michiyo's daughter.
sen.cmt: 疑問を実際に疑問文として処理しなくとも、原文により近いかたちでの訳出が可能です。
sen.e: Therefore, it is questionable whether she was atually Michiyo's daughter.
